name: Sertanejo
description: Acoustic guitar-based and originated from the rural parts of Brazilian Center-South region.

children.name: Rasqueado
children.description: Regional dance and its accompanying music from the Brazilian midwest, predominantly the state of Mato Grosso.

children.name: Sertanejo de raiz
children.description: Earliest form of Sertanejo, emerging in pre-World War II rural Brazil during the late 1920s; quickly strummed acoustic guitars, most commonly the 10-string viola caipira and classical guitar, and a highly emotive vocal style.

children.name: Sertanejo romântico
children.description: Electric instrumentation and romantic lyrics, made popular nationwide during the mid-to-late 1980s.

children.name: Sertanejo universitário
children.description: Modernized style combining rural themes and acoustic instrumentation with commercial production and Electronic instrumentation.
